intro: Geanthus fimbriobracteatus, commonly known as the fringed-bract geanthus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of its branches. Its leaves are elliptical and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, contributing to its unique appearance. Geanthus fimbriobracteatus thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude forests and rocky habitats.
